clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Stress Urinary Incontinence in Women With Autologous Adipose-derived Mesenchymal Stem Cells
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment of Stress Urinary Incontinence in Women With Autologous Adipose-derived Mesenchymal Stem Cells Mixed With Collagen Gel

lead_sponsor.agency: Institute of Biophysics and Cell Engineering of National Academy of Sciences of Belarus

clinical_study.source: Institute of Biophysics and Cell Engineering of National Academy of Sciences of Belarus

brief_summary.textblock: Treatment of women with stress urinary incontinence using injection of autologous adipose-derived mesenchymal stem cells mixed with collagen gel

detailed_description.textblock:
During the implementation of the project, method for the treatment of women stress urinary incontinence using injection of autologous adipose-derived mesenchymal stem cells mixed with collagen was developed.
Effectiveness of MSCs is due to the following:
- the ability of MSCs to stimulate tissue regeneration
- positive results of preclinical studies of the method of treatment of stress urinary incontinence (SUI) in animals (female rats).
After gynecological examination, diagnosis of SUI, MSCs were isolated from adipose tissue, cultured and then transplanted back to directly under mucosa of urethra by three point injection in one third distal from the urethral neck at 3, 6 and 9 o'clock and to the paraurethral area.
Injected volume was 3 ml per patient. For injection MSCs (6*10^6 cells) were mixed with collagen solution (3,5% w|w).
Follow up patients monitoring was mperformed at 2, 4, 6 and 12 months after injection.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with treatment-related adverse events
primary_outcome.description: MSC application related adverse events assessed by blood count, liver and function tests

arm_group.description: Patients with Stress urinary incontinence receiving standard treatment plus adipose-derived mesenchymal stem cells
Patients with Stress urinary incontinence receiving standard treatment

intervention.description: Autologous adipose-derived mesenchymal stem cells mixed with collagen solution

intervention.intervention_name: Standard treatment according to the Clinical protocols
intervention.description: Standard treatment according to the Clinical protocols

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Stress urinary incontinence
- absence of acute inflammatory manifestations in the genitourinary system
Exclusion Criteria:
- urethral or bladder malformations
- acute and chronic infectious diseases: HIV, viral hepatitis, tuberculosis
- mental disorders

overall_official.affiliation: Head of the Lab of Institute of Biophysics and Cell Engineering
Associate Professor of Department of Surgical Diseases
